Mike Pence said this was his first town hall since the Tucson, Ariz., shootings and he always consults with local law enforcement on security at such events. To me the focus is and should remain on public safety. We volunteer for these jobs, but just because someone comes to a town hall meeting, they should never have to be concerned that there's not a reasonable amount of security, he said. He said town hall meetings are "very routine" for him and said he was grateful that everyone came out Monday in the wake of the Tucson shootings. Previous article Grand jury

will be sad to see Ambassador Jon Huntsman, a potential 2012 presidential contender, leave his post in Beijing. "He has been a very fine representative of our country in China," Richard Lugar tells us. He brings a great background in politics and international relations. I regret that he's leaving at this particular point because his service has been important and will continue to be.
